programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The discovery of 716 stone discs by a Chinese scholar in a remote cave in 1938. The so-called Dropa Stones were found with what appeared to be the remains of many short humanoids.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts explore the disappearance of civilisations throughout time and across the globe, wondering if clues left in their wake point to an otherwordly explanation.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: Dave has a crisis of confidence after two of his rivals have a successful haul, while Paul's training methods prove too much for his inexperienced first mate.

programme.title: Mountain Men
programme.desc: As winter sets in, Morgan hunts for riches in the ruins, Jason tackles a river giant; and Eustace makes a breakthrough with black powder.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit the sites of famous American Civil War battles to unearth valuable and quirky collectibles.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer wants to sell a coat allegedly made of rare monkey fur. Seth is tempted to make a purchase that could prove beneficial to the finances of the business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The toss of a coin determines the value of a gold chain Les believes is out of fashion. A customer is upset when Seth prevents her from using the staff toilets.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actor Danny Dyer takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Sara Pascoe and tennis coach Judy Murray joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Lou Sanders chews on stationery, Sian Gibson is crushed by a caravan, Paul Sinha wrecks a camera, Joe Thomas gets cross and Iain Stirling waves a stick about.

programme.title: Dara O Briain's Go 8 Bit
programme.desc: Kerry Howard hopes to perform better than her brother Russell as she and Ore Oduba join Dara O Briain, Steve McNeil and Sam Pamphilon for more gaming challenges.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Gendle and Tim have two wheelie bins full of junk and just three days to create a spectacular moment with a pro athlete.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's ‘Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: The First Silent Night
programme.desc: Simon Callow discovers the origin of the Christmas carol and the story of the two Austrians who wrote it.

programme.title: History's Greatest Hoaxes
programme.desc: The story of Orson Welles' infamous radio adaptation of HG Wells' The War of the Worlds, which many Americans mistook for a news broadcast about a real alien invasion.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki investigates the discovery of human bones on a former traveller site which could be the remains of a senior police officer's missing teenage daughter. However, her forensic analysis raises even greater questions and casts doubt on the guilt of the chief suspect. Meanwhile, Harry is assigned to an insurance case that takes a peculiar twist. Emilia Fox and Tom Ward star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: A Different Type of Threat - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Heaton and Meadows argue about the wisdom of using an inexperienced officer in undercover surveillance, Will is lured into a trap and ends up in a fight at the community centre, leaving Emma wondering whether she knows him at all. Mickey Webb rushes to the rescue as the timer of a bomb planted by Euan Thomas runs down at the NSAB headquarters. Matt Hinckley persuades Emma to marry him.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: 1000 Heartbeats
programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win £25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How splinters of bone helped forensic investigators to trace a murderer four years after the victim first disappeared.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2015, Edward Lowry was found savagely beaten to death in South Dakota. With little evidence left behind, police had to piece together Ed's last moments from CCTV.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Patricia Kimmi, who disappeared from her home in Horton, Kansas, in November 2009. Roger Hollister, an acquaintance of the victim's husband, was later convicted of murder after his wife led detectives to a piece of land where skeletal human remains were unearthed and confirmed to be Kimmi's.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The investigation into a triple homicide that took place at a coffee shop in Washington DC in 1997. The killings were apparently the result of a robbery that went awry - but it was a further two years before a suspect was apprehended.

programme.title: Animal Cops Miami
programme.desc: Investigators find a puppy suffering without water or shelter, and a tourist attraction has an unwanted visitor - an alligator.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown turns his attention to an amorous rabbit, a malnourished platypus and a pet that has escaped multiple times.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer tries to bond with her estranged half-sister while shopping for a dress, and a bride looks for the perfect gown to impress her fiance.
